project: Telegram Bot User Session Book Search Solution
description: Solution for triggering book search pipeline using Telegram user sessions instead of Bot API

problem_solved.issue: Bot API messages don't trigger book search pipeline like manual messages
problem_solved.root_cause: Bot API sends FROM bot TO user (outgoing), bot only processes FROM user TO bot (incoming)
problem_solved.impact: No pipeline trigger, no book search, no EPUB delivery

solution.approach: Send messages AS USER to bot using personal API credentials
solution.result: 100% identical pipeline execution as manual typing

pipeline_flow.manual: User Types → Telegram → Bot Receives → Pipeline Triggers
pipeline_flow.bot_api_failed: Bot API → User Receives → Bot Never Sees → No Pipeline
pipeline_flow.user_session_working: User Session → Telegram → Bot Receives → Pipeline Triggers

critical_insights: Bot message handlers only process INCOMING messages (TO bot)
Bot API creates OUTGOING messages (FROM bot) - never processed
User Session creates INCOMING messages (FROM user) - always processed
Same user ID (14835038) required for identical logs
MTProto protocol (user session) vs HTTP Bot API difference

success_metrics.epub_delivery: Complete book search and file delivery

business_value.epub_automation: Complete book search and delivery automation
business_value.development_efficiency: No need for manual testing every time

next_steps: Scale testing to more book titles
Document edge cases and error handling
